text: The Curtiss XP-19 was ordered in 1930 and was to have been a single-seat, low- wing monoplane powered by a Wright IV-1560 engine. The design was cancelled before any were built.Fahey, James C.,US Army Aircraft 1908–1946, 1946, Ships and Aircraft, New York. ==References== Category:Cancelled military aircraft projects of the United States P-19 Category:Single-engine aircraft Category:Low-wing aircraft
title: Curtiss XP-19
